title: 1701-A
statement: A. Grass Fieldtime limit per test1 secondmemory limit per test256 megabytesinputstandard inputoutputstandard outputThere is a field of size $$$2 \\times 2$$$. Each cell of this field can either contain grass or be empty. The value $$$a_{i, j}$$$ is $$$1$$$ if the cell $$$(i, j)$$$ contains grass, or $$$0$$$ otherwise.In one move, you can chooseone rowandone columnand cut all the grass in this row and this column. In other words, you choose the row $$$x$$$ and the column $$$y$$$, then you cut the grass in all cells $$$a_{x, i}$$$ and all cells $$$a_{i, y}$$$ for all $$$i$$$ from $$$1$$$ to $$$2$$$. After you cut the grass from a cell, it becomes empty (i. e. its value is replaced by $$$0$$$).Your task is to find the minimum number of moves required to cut the grass in all non-empty cells of the field (i. e. make all $$$a_{i, j}$$$ zeros).You have to answer $$$t$$$ independent test cases.InputThe first line of the input contains one integer $$$t$$$ ($$$1 \\le t \\le 16$$$) — the number of test cases. Then $$$t$$$ test cases follow.The test case consists of two lines, each of these lines contains two integers. The $$$j$$$-th integer in the $$$i$$$-th row is $$$a_{i, j}$$$. If $$$a_{i, j} = 0$$$ then the cell $$$(i, j)$$$ is empty, and if $$$a_{i, j} = 1$$$ the cell $$$(i, j)$$$ contains grass.OutputFor each test case, print one integer — the minimum number of moves required to cut the grass in all non-empty cells of the field (i. e. make all $$$a_{i, j}$$$ zeros) in the corresponding test case.ExampleInput30 00 01 00 11 11 1Output0 1 2

processed.result:
You are given a 2x2 grid. Each cell in the grid can either contain grass (represented by 1) or be empty (represented by 0).

You can perform a move by selecting a row and a column. This action will cut all the grass in that row and that column.

Your goal is to find the fewest number of moves needed to remove all the grass from the grid. 


Input:

The input consists of multiple test cases. Each test case is represented by a 2x2 grid of numbers (0s and 1s).

Output:

For each test case, output the minimum number of moves required to remove all the grass.
You have a 2x2 grid. Each cell can be either empty or have grass. You can cut a whole row or a whole column to remove the grass. Find the fewest cuts needed to remove all the grass.
